definitions.definition: government by a ruler or small group of people who have unlimited power over the people in their country or state and use it unfairly and cruelly:
examples: This, the president promised us, was a war against tyranny.

definitions.definition: a situation in which someone or something controls how you are able to live, in an unfair way:
examples: Women, the play seems to suggest, must resist the tyranny of domesticity.
